intro: Nototriche longicaudicalis, commonly known as the long-tailed nototriche, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats and has hairy stems and leaves. Its unique long, slender calyx is a distinguishing feature, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Nototriche longicaudicalis is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
